# Conflicts:

commitResults.messageTitle: Add the ability to mark tasks as done. Optionally, add the ability to change the status back to not done.
test
Add support for tracking three types of tasks:
commitResults.messageBody:
ToDos: tasks without any date/time attached to it e.g., visit new theme park
Deadlines: tasks that need to be done before a specific date/time e.g., submit report by 11/10/2019 5pm
Events: tasks that start at a specific date/time and ends at a specific date/time
e.g., (a) team project meeting 2/10/2019 2-4pm (b) orientation week 4/10/2019 to 11/10/2019

commitResults.messageTitle: Use the input/output redirection technique to semi-automate the testing of Mentos.
Teach the chatbot to deal with errors such as incorrect inputs entered by the user.
Add support for deleting tasks from the list.
Added Javadocs
Save the tasks in the hard disk automatically whenever the task list changes. Load the data from the hard disk when the chatbot starts up.

Teach the chatbot how to understand dates and times. For example, if the command is deadline return book /by 2/12/2019 1800, the chatbot should understand 2/12/2019 1800 as 2nd of December 2019, 6pm, instead of treating it as just a String.
Refactor the code to extract out closely related code as classes.
commitResults.messageBody:
Minimal: Extract the following classes:
Ui: deals with interactions with the user
Storage: deals with loading tasks from the file and saving tasks in the file
Parser: deals with making sense of the user command
TaskList: contains the task list e.g., it has operations to add/delete tasks in the list

remove additional redundant lines

commitResults.messageTitle: configured build gradle
Add JUnit tests to test the behavior of the code.
Package the app as an executable JAR file so that it can be distributed easily.
Fix Exception String
Added javadocs
enforce coding standard
Merge tag 'A-CodingStandard'
Give users a way to find a task by searching for a keyword in the task description.
Add a GUI to the chatbot. Use the JavaFX technology to implement the GUI.
Add assertions to document key assumptions in Mentos class
commitResults.messageBody:
- Added `assert` statements to ensure valid task indices during task operations (mark, unmark, delete,searchTaskGUI).
- Validated that tasks are loaded correctly from storage with assertions.
- Ensured non-null and valid task objects before adding, marking, or unmarking tasks.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor command handling to an OOP structure
commitResults.messageBody:
- Converted individual commands (List, Mark, Unmark, Delete, ToDo, Deadline, Event, Find) into their own classes.
- Improved task handling logic by leveraging polymorphism and encapsulation for better maintainability.
- Replaced the if-else structure with an object-oriented design, promoting cleaner code and separation of concerns.
- Simplified the `taskHandler` method to dynamically handle commands through respective command objects.

commitResults.messageTitle: Update test cases for assertions
Add support for editing details of existing items
commitResults.messageBody:
- Implemented functionality to allow users to update specific details of items (e.g., changing the end time of an event) without deleting the item.
- Enabled editing of task details (e.g., description, date) while preserving other information.

commitResults.messageTitle: Deleted the ActionTaskTuple class as it was no longer being used in the codebase.
